text: is the head of analytics and data I run
data science data engineering data
management we have a lot of customers
and that means that we want to be able
to engage them and personalize our
messaging for them which is a challenge
when you have 20 million customers so we
have to do it with machine learning and
with data and analytics we chose AWS
because the architecture of AWS is set
up in a way that we could pick and
choose which components we wanted to
leverage our account managers the
architecture the pro serve support all
meant that we could move faster the
first thing we did was move all of our
data to S3 to develop a machine learning
and ml Ops Suite that would allow us to
build models quickly we built a tool set
including EMR and sagemaker and awss3 to
be able to um shorten that Journey so
now we're at about three months to put a
bottle into production and we have
almost 100 and machine learning models
in the bank and we'll probably have
thousands in the next two years what we
found was that there were a set of
customers that were using pay for ATMs
and they were mostly in relatively poor
neighborhoods that couldn't afford to be
paying ATM fees so we built a messaging
tool that personalized a message and
said hey in the last 30 days you've
spent 40 pounds on ATM fees and there's
an ATM that's free that's two blocks
away that one model and message has
saved those customers almost half a
million pounds in the first six months
of the year so the impact has just been
massive for the customers it's decreased
fraud it's increased their well-being it
saved the money so overall it's a pretty
incredible story
